title: Zaha Hadid Architects updates progress on Shenzhen Science and Technology Museum construction
author: Josh Niland
excerpt: Zaha Hadid Architects is moving towards the end of construction for the Shenzhen Science and Technology Museum. What will become the
text: anchor Image: © Zaha Hadid Architects. Visualization by Slashcube Zaha Hadid Architects is moving towards the end of construction for the Shenzhen Science and Technology Museum.  What will become the "pearl" of the city’s Guangming Science City district is just a few short months from completion. When it opens, it will yield about 1.35 million square feet of learning and exhibition space wrapped in a high-performance envelope that emerges from Guangming Park to address the city to the east orientation. ZHA tells us: "The museum’s procurement, full life-cycle performance and adaptability for future configuration are also evaluated and assessed to reduce embodied carbon and achieve the highest Three-Star rating of China’s Green Building Evaluation Standard."
html:
• anchor

    Image: © Zaha Hadid Architects. Visualization by Slashcube

    Zaha Hadid Architects is moving towards the end of construction for the Shenzhen Science and Technology Museum. 

    What will become the "pearl" of the city’s Guangming Science City district is just a few short months from completion. When it opens, it will yield about 1.35 million square feet of learning and exhibition space wrapped in a high-performance envelope that emerges from Guangming Park to address the city to the east orientation.

    ZHA tells us: "The museum’s procurement, full life-cycle performance and adaptability for future configuration are also evaluated and assessed to reduce embodied carbon and achieve the highest Three-Star rating of China’s Green Building Evaluation Standard."
